definition[0]: to make something exist that did not exist before
example[0]: Some people believe the universe was created by a big explosion.
example[1]: Her behaviour is creating a lot of problems.
example[2]: The new factory is expected to create more than 400 new jobs.
example[3]: This dish was created by our chef Jean Richard.
example[4]: Philip Glass created a new kind of music.
example[5]: The software makes it easy to create colourful graphs.
example[6]: The building boom has created 50,000 construction jobs in the state.
example[7]: The two organizations will create a company to sell life insurance in Spain, with each providing 50% of the capital.
example[8]: Central banks can create money by getting private banks to lend more.
example[9]: Tourism creates wealth for the country.
example[10]: The design agency has created a number of American Express ads.
example[11]: The technology can be used to create new products.
